intro: Trochomeria rotundata, commonly known as the roundleaf trochomeria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are rounded and often have a slight pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Trochomeria rotundata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
